Class dom.session.View 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.View
Subclasses:
ClientView, ServerView
public abstract class View
extends java.lang.Object
Base class for all 'Views' of a multipoint group. This is the local object that represents the multipoint group to the locally hosted presences of DObjects (objects that are clients of this reliable group messaging services), and serves as their reliable link to a distributed group of DObject presences (both host and client presences are assumed to be subclasses fo the DObject root class).

This is an abstract superclass, that implements the multipoint group functionality in a network topology independent way. It's considered the responsibility of subclasses of this class to implement network topology-specific View functionality. For example, see the ClientView and ServerView subclasses for the implementation of the 'star' topology. The purpose for this abstract superclass is to allow the the introduction of new network messaging topologies (e.g. multicast IP), WITH the associated reliability/group membership manager, while keeping the abstract interface available to client (DObject) code, totally untouched. Note that their are two roles that this View can take: group manager or not group manager. There can only be one group manager per multipoint group. The group manager is primarily responsible for determining who can enter the existing group and sending the group membership change information to non-group managers. Note that in the 'star' topology that the group manager will be the one ServerView, but in the multicast tree topology (e.g.), the group manager role is one that is not dictated by the connectivity, and could conceivably even move dynamically (although this would take some work).

This class provides access (to untrusted DObjects) to only one resource: sending data to the other presences of themselves on remote processes. This functionality is provided by the methods: sendDataToPresences(...), and sendDataToPresenceAtView(...). These are the basic messaging primitives for DObject presences to send data to their other presences only. Actually, these interfaces are exposed to DObjects via the ViewDObjectFacet, which is a facet on this class that exposes the messaging functionality provided by this View to DObjects upon construction (see the DObject constructor).

Note that all of the methods on this class are declared protected, meaning that in an open turing machine world remotely loaded code (which would be guaranteed by the classloader to be from outside this package), will have no direct access to these methods, and will only have access to the methods exposed via facet classes (e.g. the ViewDObjectFacet). Locally trusted subclasses, however, will be free to override behavior as necessary.

This class also provides access to two 'meta' interfaces for DObjects. One is the getViewFacet interface, that allows DObjects to explicitly request access to other services provided by the local runtime (since in the most restrictive case the DObject has an external reference only to this View, it must ask this View for system resources, etc. as needed). For example, if a DObject presence must get access to the user interface, it would have to explicitly ask via the getViewFacet method, and the local system would have the opportunity to assess the request and respond appropriately...by, for example, providing access to a facet to a local system resource (e.g. the UI).

The second 'meta-interface' is the DObject<->DObject meta-protocol. The two relevant methods on this class for this meta protocol are: requestDObjectCapability and giveDObjectCapability. This meta protocol is to allow local DObject presences to establish direct messaging between each other's presences, as dictated by their semantics, using a locally trusted third party (this View object). Essentially, this supports the equivalent of 'Unum facets'. The meta-protocol is based around the same 'PO Box' model that is used in the secure identity-based capability exchange built by Trevor and myself.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
DObject

Normal (protected) constructor for this view. Simply takes SessionViewID that this view will use and initializes member variables

Method Detail

getID

public final SessionViewID getID()
Get the SessionViewID for this view. Always returns the id associated with this view. Final so that untrusted code can trust that this does the 'right' thing (!).
Returns:
SessionViewID that is this views' id

getCurrentGroupMembers

protected final SessionViewID[] getCurrentGroupMembers()
Get the current group membership, in the form of an array of SessionViewID objects.
Returns:
Object[] containing the SessionViewIDs of all of the views currently in this group

getMyRank

protected final int getMyRank()
Get the rank of this view within the group. This is determined at group membership time...i.e. by the group manager (which might be us). A value of VIEW_NOT_GROUP_MEMBER means that we are not currently connected to a group.
Returns:
int that represents my rank in the multipoint group. A value equal to VIEW_NOT_GROUP_MEMBER means that this view is currently unconnected

Determine whether this view is currently connected to a group.
Returns:
true if connected to a group, false otherwise

Determine whether this view is currently *trying* to connect to another group (in the waitingToConnect state)
Returns:
true if currently waiting to connect, false otherwise

isServer

protected abstract boolean isServer()
Called by DObjects to determine whether this view is a server view. Abstract since only true (or even relevant), when using a 'star' topology and this is a ServerView.
Returns:
true if is a server view, false otherwise. Abstract because its value has to be determined by subclasses that 'know' about the network topology.

isGroupManager

protected boolean isGroupManager()
Determine whether this view is a group manager or not
Returns:
true if this view is currently the group manager, false if not

sendDataToPresences

protected void sendDataToPresences(DObjectPacket data) throws java.io.IOException
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to any/all other remote views known to exist to this view. This is the primary primitive used by DObjects to send arbitrary data to remote presences of itself.
Parameters:
data - the DObjectPacket containing any data to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent
See Also:
sendDataToPresences

sendDataToPresenceAtView

protected void sendDataToPresenceAtView(SessionViewID to,
                                        DObjectPacket data) throws java.io.IOException
Send data contained in DObjectPacket to the presence at the view specified in the 'to' parameter. In addition to sendDataToPresences, this is a primary messaging primitive for DObjects to use to send arbitrary data to their remote presences.
Parameters:
to - the SessionViewID that the data is going to
data - the DObjectPacket containing any data to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if data cannot be sent
See Also:
sendDataToPresences

activateDObject

protected void activateDObject(DObjectID id) throws DObjectNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
Method to explicitly activate an inactive DObject. This can be called by DObjects to explicitly activate themselves. If DObject the provided is not currently on the inactive list, a DObjectNotFoundException will be thrown. Note that this can also be called by trusted (e.g. administration code).
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the object to be activated
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - thrown if the given id is not currently on the inactive list

deactivateDObject

protected void deactivateDObject(DObjectID id) throws DObjectNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
Method to explicitly deactivate an active DObject. This can be called by DObjects to explicitly deactivate an active presence of a DObject. If the DObject is not currently on the active list, a DObjectNotFoundException will be thrown. Note that this can also be called by locally trusted (e.g. administration) code.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the object to be deactivated
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - thrown if the given id is not currently on the active list

destroyDObject

protected void destroyDObject(DObjectID id) throws DObjectNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
Method to explicitly destroy a DObject. This can be called by DObjects to explicitly destroy an active presence of a DObject. If the DObject is not currently on the active list, a DObjectNotFoundException will be thrown. Note that this can also be called by locally trusted (e.g. administration) code.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the object to be destroyed
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - thrown if the given id is not currently on the active list
java.lang.SecurityException - is thrown if the given DObject (first param) does not have the authority to move the given id

sendSessionViewMsg

protected final void sendSessionViewMsg(SessionViewID toID,
                                        int msg,
                                        SessionViewData data) throws java.io.IOException
Send the data associated with the given msg to the View with the given SessionViewID.
Parameters:
toID - the SessionViewID of the View to receive the message. If null, then the message is directed to all current members of the multipoint group.
msg - the msg type
data - the SessionViewData to send (dependent upon msg type)

joinGroup

protected final void joinGroup(SessionViewID viewToJoin) throws java.lang.Exception
Primary access to joining an existing multipoint group. This will block until a) the connection has been formed to the group (still not *admitted* but well on the way...modulo authentication); b) an IO exception (i.e. connection could not be created) is thrown. If access to the group is granted, a "joinOK" message from the group manager will be received...and that is the final word that we (and potentially all our objects) will be allowed to join the group. If this is called while this view is already a member of a group (before leave is called) then it will throw an exception.

Note that this and the leaveGroup methods would be exposed to the appropriate DObject code (e.g. Avatars or Teleport Pads, etc) to allow them to determine what group this view was connected to (i.e. move from 'place' to 'place'. Note that these are not exposed to all DObjects by default, rather a facet for this functionality will have to be created and explicitly given out to the 'deserving' DObjects.

Parameters:
viewToJoin - the SessionViewID that represents the group we wish to join
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if there is some problem joining group (group unreachable, security disallows join request, already a member of a group, etc.)

reallyJoinGroup

protected abstract void reallyJoinGroup(SessionViewID groupManager) throws java.io.IOException
Abstract method to really do work of making connection to remote process group. Should only be called from joinGroup, rather than directly. Assumes that view is not connected nor is waiting to connect. This method blocks until transport level connection is made (but group level connection is not yet established...that only happens when response is received from group manager).
Parameters:
target - the SessionViewID that identifies the target group manager for our connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem making connection to remote group

leaveGroup

protected final void leaveGroup() throws java.lang.Exception
Primary method to leave a group. Will throw an exception if not already in a group, or group cannot be left.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem with leaving the group

leaveGroup

protected final void leaveGroup(SessionViewID groupManager) throws java.lang.Exception
Primary method to leave a group. Group manager of group to be left is specified as first parameter. This method will generate a VIEW_LEAVE message to the specified group manager.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem with leaving the group

notifyDObjectCreated

protected final void notifyDObjectCreated(DObject object)
Notification from DObject (parameter is provided as key to assure identity), that DObject has received and processed the 'created' message from the local view. This is passed on to the view list manager, so that it can deal with this notification as desired (typically by making some other state change on the DObject).
Parameters:
object - the DObject that is notifying us that it has received and processed the 'created' message

sendJoinMsg

protected void sendJoinMsg(SessionViewID groupManager,
                           SessionViewData data) throws java.io.IOException

Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with queueing the message
See Also:

getJoinMsgData

protected SessionViewData getJoinMsgData(SessionViewID groupManager)
Get data for join message. This method is charged with the responsibility of retrieving any and all data needed for sending in the group 'join' message. In general, this will consist of whatever data (e.g. authentication data) that is needed by the group manager to grant/deny entry to the group.
Parameters:
target - the SessionViewID of the group manager to request entry from.
Returns:
SessionViewData the data to send with the join request to the group manager.

getLeaveMsgData

protected SessionViewData getLeaveMsgData(SessionViewID groupManager)

Parameters:
target - the URL that identifies the group manager to request entry from.
Returns:
SessionViewData the data to send with the join request to the group manager.

checkForAdmission

protected abstract GroupAdmissionCheck checkForAdmission(SessionViewID id,
                                                         SessionViewData data) throws java.io.IOException
Check for whether given SessionViewID, with given SessionViewData (sent with join request) should be allowed to enter the group. This method always should return a non-null instance of GroupAdmissionCheck. Subclasses will implement as necessary. Caller (GroupConnectionHandler. handleJoinMsg) should guarantee that this view object is the current group manager (e.g. ClientView will throw if not). The implementations of this method in subclasses should *always* either a) throw an exception; b) return a non-null GroupAdmissionCheck object.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID that is requesting group admission
data - the data that accompanies the id provided
Returns:
GroupAdmissionCheck object that contains the relevant result information
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with this message to begin with (i.e. ClientReceives this message).
See Also:
GroupAdmissionCheck, handleJoinMsg

sendJoinAccept

protected void sendJoinAccept(ReliableConnection connection,
                              GroupAdmissionCheck admissionInfo) throws java.io.IOException
Send accept to join request. Takes given group admission check, adds session view id provided by admission check to group, and sends a message to the existing group members about the change, and to the new group member with the acceptance information, and information about the current contents of the group. Synchronized on the view list manager, so that we can be sure that the view does not change while this change is being communicated. This method should only be called from the GroupConnectionHandler. handleJoinMsg method. It assumes that the result field in the GroupAdmissionCheck object is true (admitted)
Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection this request is coming from
admissionInfo - the GroupAdmissionCheck to use for the new group member.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem sending messages (should not happen unless something happened with comm layer)

getRequestorAdmittedViewChange

protected ViewChange getRequestorAdmittedViewChange(GroupAdmissionCheck admissionInfo)
Get the ViewChange object for admitting a remote view

getRequestorAdmittedOthersViewChange

private ViewChange getRequestorAdmittedOthersViewChange(GroupAdmissionCheck info)
Get the ViewChange object for admitting a remote view that will be sent to all of the *other* views
Parameters:
info - the GroupAdmissionCheck that has admitted a remote view to a group that we manage

getNextRank

protected int getNextRank()
Method to increment (first) and then return rank for a view to be added. Only actually implemented by the group manager. Subclasses must therefore provide implementation. Client subclasses should always return VIEW_NOT_GROUP_MEMBER. Server subclasses should return a valid integer > VIEW_IS_GROUP_MANAGER.
Returns:
int that gives a valid, unique rank in group to a new view

getMaxRank

protected int getMaxRank()
Get the current maximum rank...this is the rank value of the *last* view added to group. Only actually used by the group manager. Returns current size of group -1.
Returns:
int maximum rank of the views currently in the group

sendJoinFailure

protected void sendJoinFailure(ReliableConnection connection,
                               GroupAdmissionCheck admissionInfo) throws java.io.IOException
Send failure back to join request. Takes given group admission check, and sends failure response to failed session view only

This method should only be called from the GroupConnectionHandler. handleJoinMsg method. It assumes that the result field in the GroupAdmissionCheck object is false (not admitted)

Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection this request is coming from
admissionInfo - the GroupAdmissionCheck to use for the failure response
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem sending message (should not happen unless something happened with comm layer)

getRequestorFailedViewChange

private ViewChange getRequestorFailedViewChange(GroupAdmissionCheck admissionInfo)
Get the ViewChange object for rejecting a remote view
Parameters:
info - the GroupAdmissionCheck that has admitted a remote view to a group that we manage

addGroupSuccessful

protected void addGroupSuccessful(SessionViewID groupManager,
                                  ViewChange viewChangeInfo) throws java.io.IOException
Our request was granted, and we're now in group. Update group information and local state
Parameters:
groupManager - the SessionViewID of the groupManager
viewChange - the ViewChange object from the groupManager
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem dealing with this information (i.e. we don't like the ID of this group manager

addGroupFailure

protected void addGroupFailure(SessionViewID groupManager,
                               ViewChange viewChangeInfo)
Our attempt to join a group has failed.
Parameters:
groupManager - the SessionViewID of the group manager that rejected us
viewChangeInfo - the viewChangeInfo sent with the rejection

sendLeaveAccept

protected void sendLeaveAccept(ReliableConnection connection,
                               GroupAdmissionCheck result) throws java.io.IOException
Send leave accept message back to view id (wrapper by result parameter). Atomically (synchronized on list manager) removes view id and then sends message to view telling them that they are now out.
Parameters:
result - the GroupAdmissionCheck instance that wraps the view id that is leaving
Throws:
java.io.IOException - is thrown if some io problem
See Also:
handleLeaveMsg

getLeaveRequestorViewChange

private ViewChange getLeaveRequestorViewChange(GroupAdmissionCheck admissionInfo)
Get the view change information for the requestor that is leaving. This information is returned to the leaving view
Parameters:
admissionInfo - the admission info associated with the departure. If this parameter is null, it means that the view left unexpectedly...i.e. because of a crash

getLeaveOthersViewChange

protected ViewChange getLeaveOthersViewChange(SessionViewID goneViewID)
Get the view change information for the that are not leaving about a view that is leaving. This information is returned to all other views
Parameters:
admissionInfo - the admission info associated with the departure

leaveGroupSuccessful

protected void leaveGroupSuccessful(SessionViewID groupManager,
                                    ViewChange viewChangeInfo)
Leave request response received and our leave request was successful. In response to this (client only in client-server topology), we just close the connection.
Parameters:
groupManager - the SessionViewID of the group manager responding to our departure request
viewChange - the ViewChange that the group manager sent back to us

handleDObjectPacketMsg

protected void handleDObjectPacketMsg(SessionViewID fromID,
                                      SessionViewID toID,
                                      DObjectPacket packet) throws java.io.IOException
Handle a message indicating that some remote DObject presence has sent data to its DObject presence on this machine. Note this is the message receiver for *all* DObject presence-to-presence messaging. All this handler does is process the packet by looking for the DObject identified by the appropriate DObjectID and asynchronously giving this packet to the target DObject presence (the actual delivery is synchronized on the list manager to prevent View changes from happening simultaneously. This is very important).

NOTE: This is essentially a message demultiplexor. It takes a generic message intended for this View, interprets some message routing bits (the DObjectID) and then finds and delivers to the corresponding DObject.

Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the sending view
toID - the SessionViewID of this view
packet - the DObjectPacket that is to be delivered

sendCreateMsg

protected void sendCreateMsg(SessionViewID toID,
                             CreateDObjectData data) throws java.io.IOException
Send create DObject message to remote view. Assumes that relevant required data is present in CreateDObjectData data parameter. Exactly *what* this data consists of (in addition to the basic required stuff) is dependant upon the requirements of the group manager we are asking.
Parameters:
toID - the SessionViewID of the view where we are trying to create a DObject on
data - the SessionViewData that we are sending to the remote view
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with queueing the message
See Also:
getCreateMsgData

getCreateMsgData

protected SessionViewData getCreateMsgData(SessionViewID toID,
                                           CreateDObjectData data)
Get data for create message. This method is charged with the responsibility of retrieving any and all data needed for sending in the group 'create' message. In general, this will consist of whatever data (e.g. authentication data) that is needed by the remote to grant/deny entry to the group.
Parameters:
target - the SessionViewID of the remote view to receive the request
data - the CreateDObjectData that will be sent to the remote view
Returns:
SessionViewData the data to send with the create request

handleCreateMsg

protected void handleCreateMsg(SessionViewID fromID,
                               SessionViewID toID,
                               CreateDObjectData data) throws java.io.IOException
Handle create message from remote. This is the main message handler for the DObject create message, which is responsible for creating all DObject client presences. This interprets the create message, calls a method (checkCreateDObject) that allows a local security check to be done before the DObject presence is created, and if successful begins the DObject creation (which may include classloading etc., so can't be done synchronously), by creating an instance of LoadingDObject, which is a 'placeholder' object used to represent the new DObject presence while its classes are loaded.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the View where this message originated
toID - the SessionViewID of the View where this message is intended...should be our id
data - the CreateDObjectData wrapper object used to contain all of the data associated with this create message (all of the data needed to create the DObject presence)
See Also:
LoadingDObject

forwardMsg

protected void forwardMsg(SessionViewID fromID,
                          SessionViewID toID,
                          int msg,
                          SessionViewData data)
Forward a given msg to either a) all known Views (toID == null), or a specific View (toID != null).
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the sending View
toID - the SessionViewID of the receiving View (null means all)
msg - the session view msg identifier (see SessionViewMsg class for relevant values
data - the SessionViewData (the actual data) for the message

checkDObjectCreate

protected boolean checkDObjectCreate(SessionViewID fromID,
                                     SessionViewID toID,
                                     CreateDObjectData data) throws java.io.IOException
This is the method called by the DObject creation code, to allow implementors of this class to check the validity of DObject presence creation requests, and potentially refuse them as desired. Note that this method is the locus the implementation of whatever TOS check are desired wrt to DObject presence creation (i.e. this is not for checking group entry requests, rather this allows checks and potential refusal for each individual client presence that the remote DObject host would like to construct.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the View where request originated from
toID - the SessionViewID of the View where request is intended (can be null, but if non-null should be this View's SessionViewID).
data - the CreateDObjectData that holds all of the relevant information about the DObject to be putatively created
Returns:
true if a DObject presence should be allowed, false otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if immediate disconnect should occur

endConnecting

protected abstract void endConnecting(SessionViewID groupManager,
                                      int rank)
End our view's status of being in a 'connecting' state. This method should be synchronized on the view object, so that a) the transition to a new state for this view (either connected or not) is atomic to this view; b) notifyAll() can be called so any waiting threads (joinGroup or leaveGroup methods on view) can be allowed to continue.

If the groupManager is null, this means that we have left the group, and in that case we attempt to permanently close the connection to the group. If the groupManager is non-null, we have just entered a group successfully, and things may continue.

NOTE: Any subclass implementation of this method should be synchronized.

Parameters:
groupManager - the SessionViewID of our group manager. If null, this means that we have successfully left a group. If non-null, we have successfully been added to a group
rank - our rank in the group (provided by manager)

handleDisconnect

protected void handleDisconnect(ReliableConnection connection,
                                java.lang.Exception e,
                                Queue unsent)
Handle disconnect of a connection. This method deals with any exception from our underlying group messaging protocol. This is called by the GroupConnectionHandler, and that, in turn, is called by the sender/receiver threads on a given connection.

This method *must* ultimately (and synchronously) close the connection provided in the first parameter. Before doing so, we close and then deal with any message on the queue provided as the third parameter...these are any unsent messages on the queue when the exception was raised.

Parameters:
connection - the Reliable connection that is the source of the exception
e - the Exception that caused this to be called
unsent - the Queue holding any unsent messages on the given connection

handleUnsentMessagesOnDisconnect

protected void handleUnsentMessagesOnDisconnect(Queue unsent)
Handle any unsent message that exist in queue upon disconnect. This gives the view an opportunity to deal with such messages by, for example, letting DObjects know about any unsent messages.
Parameters:
unsent - a Queue containing unsent messages. The Queue will already have been closed, and so nothing can be added to it.

closeConnection

protected void closeConnection(ReliableConnection connection)
Forcibly close the connection given. This is called to deal with an exception reported by the connection's thread. Subclasses may/should override to do what they need to do to clean up for the given connection. For example, clients will set their connection to null, server's will remove the given connection from whatever list it is on.
Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection in question

forwardFromRemoteViewExcluding

protected abstract void forwardFromRemoteViewExcluding(SessionViewID fromID,
                                                       SessionViewID excluded,
                                                       int msg,
                                                       SessionViewData data)
Forwards msg to all group members, using the 'fromID' parameter to specify where this message is from. This is implemented by the server only for fanout. This does all fanout of all messages! Client implements as a nop.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID to put in 'fromID' field of the packet
excluded - a SessionViewID to exclude. If null, everyone is sent the message
msg - the SessionViewMsg to send
data - the SessionViewData to send with the message

forwardFromRemoteViewToRemoteView

protected abstract void forwardFromRemoteViewToRemoteView(SessionViewID fromID,
                                                          SessionViewID toID,
                                                          int msg,
                                                          SessionViewData data)
Forwards msg to one specific group member, using the 'fromID' parameter to specify where this message is from. This is implemented by the server (only). This does message routing.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID to put in 'fromID' field of the packet
toID - the SessionViewID to put in the 'toID' field of the packet
msg - the SessionViewMsg to send
data - the SessionViewData to send with the message

addGroupMember

protected void addGroupMember(ReliableConnection connection,
                              SessionViewID viewID)
Add a group member to our set of known group members. The connection is also (sometimes) passed through, so that subclasses that override this method can get at the connection that directly corresponds to the given viewid.

NOTE: If subclasses override this method, they should call super.addGroupMember as part of their code.

Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection this group member is coming from (can be null)
viewID - the SessionViewID associated with this new group member

removeGroupMember

protected void removeGroupMember(ReliableConnection connection,
                                 SessionViewID viewID)
Remove a group member from our set of known group members. The connection is also (sometimes) passed through, so that subclasses that override this method can get at the connection that directly corresponds to the given viewid.

NOTE: If subclasses override this method, they should call super.removeGroupMember as part of their code.

Parameters:
connection - the ReliableConnection this group member is coming from (can be null)
viewID - the SessionViewID associated with this group member to remove

getViewFacet

protected BaseFacet getViewFacet(DObject object,
                                 java.lang.String request,
                                 java.lang.Object data)
Generic meta-interface for DObjects to get facets on the local view. This interface can be used to make arbitrary requests of the local view securely. The untrusted subclass of this class cannot call the view.getViewFacet method directly, but rather only through this call.
Parameters:
object - the DObject making the request
request - a String identifying the desired service from the view
data - arbitrary data associated with the request
Returns:
BaseFacet that is a facet on the local view. Can be null if view does not wish to provide a facet for the service.
See Also:
getViewFacet

getDObjectRunQueue

protected Enqueable getDObjectRunQueue(DObject object)
Meta interface for responding to DObject initial requests for a run queue to support its own code execution. This is called by the ViewDObjectFacet getDObjectRunQueue method, in response to a request from a new DObject. By changing the contents of this method, a View can control what run queue a DObject uses to run its code.

By default a new instance of a Thread object is created with a new DObjectRunner to define the message processing loop. Also a new Queue object is allocated and some implementer of the Enqueable interface is returned (in the default case it is an instance of the Queue class itself.

Note that new types Enqueables can be created and returned such that a single run queue is shared, or whatever combination of single/multiple run queues are desired.

Parameters:
object - the DObject that is making the request
Returns:
Enqueable that we wish to provide back to the DObject
See Also:
getDObjectRunQueue, DObjectRunner, Queue

getDObjectClassloader

protected ViewClassLoader getDObjectClassloader(DObjectID id,
                                                SessionViewID homeID,
                                                java.net.URL codeBase,
                                                java.lang.String className)
Get the classloader for loading in remote classes for DObjects. Returns either a valid ViewClassLoader classLoader, or it returns null. If it returns null, then the null classloader will be used for loading in any required classes.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject that is to be loaded
homeID - the SessionViewID of the 'home' session for this object
codeBase - the URL codebase for the root class
className - the URL classname for the root class

loadDObject

protected DObject loadDObject(DObjectID id,
                              SessionViewID homeID,
                              java.net.URL codeBase,
                              java.lang.String className,
                              java.lang.Object initParams) throws java.lang.Exception
Load class(es) and create a new instance of a DObject (by using CRAPI getConstructor call). If provided classloader is null, uses Class.forName to load class (locally).
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject that is to be loaded
homeID - the SessionViewID of the 'home' session for this object
codeBase - the URL codebase for the root class
className - the URL classname for the root class
initParams - an Object that defines any/all params used by DObject subclasses for init
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if one of a number of problems occurs
See Also:
newInstance

moveLoadingToInactive

protected void moveLoadingToInactive(DObjectID id,
                                     DObject object) throws DObjectNotFoundException
Move the DObject identified by the first parameter, and with reference given by the second parameter from the loading queue (which has a reference to an instance of LoadingDObject) to the inactive queue.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject
object - the DObject reference
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - if the given DObject is not found on the loading queue

moveInactiveToActive

protected void moveInactiveToActive(DObjectID id) throws DObjectNotFoundException
Move the DObject identified by the first parameter from the inactive queue to the active queue.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - if the given DObject is not found on the loading queue

removeDObjectFromLoading

protected void removeDObjectFromLoading(DObjectID id)
Remove the DObject identified from the loading queue. This is idempotent and assures that the given DObject is really removed
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject to remove

createDObject

protected DObjectID createDObject(DObject creator,
                                  DObjectID id,
                                  SessionViewID homeViewID,
                                  java.net.URL codebase,
                                  java.lang.String className,
                                  java.lang.Object param,
                                  boolean activate) throws java.lang.Exception
Generic interface for creating new DObject instances. Takes a creator object, so that security checks can be made, a codebase to determine from where to load the root class (can be http, ftp, etc., as well as repository, file system, etc). Takes a class name that is the root class to load, and and array of objects to represent the parameters to be passed to the constructor. After doing the classloading, using CRAPI, this method looks for a constructor with the param types defined by the types of the objects in the params array, and then tries to invoke that constructor. If it fails for any reason then this failure propogates back up in the form of an exception. Upon success, the new object's DObjectID is returned for use by the caller.

Calling thread blocks until complete, so this should only be used by code that is prepared to deal with that.

Parameters:
creator - the DObject that wants to create a new object hosted on the local view. If null, being created by the system.
id - the DObjectID to use for the new DObject. If null, new id is created and assigned by this code.
homeViewID - the home view id for the new DObject. Determines whether a host instance (homeViewID==getID()), or a client instance (homeViewID != getID()) is being created.
codebase - the URL that identifies the codebase for the new object
className - the String identifying the class name (relative to codebase) of the root class to be loaded (this class MUST be a subclass of DObject or this will fail
param - an Object will be passed to the constructor for the newly created DObject
activate - if true, DObject is activated as soon as possible, if not, DObject left inactive until explicitly told to activate
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - is thrown for a variety of different reasons
See Also:
java.lang.reflect.Constructor, ViewClassLoader, loadDObject, DObject

getNewDObjectID

protected DObjectID getNewDObjectID() throws java.lang.Exception
Subclass overrideable helper method that returns a new, unique DObjectID. This is used in the createDObject method above.
Returns:
DObjectID a new, fresh DObjectID
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem creating id
See Also:
createDObject

addNewDObject

protected boolean addNewDObject(DObject object,
                                boolean activate)
Method to directly add a DObject to set known to this view. If activate is true, will also activate DObject as soon as possible.
Parameters:
object - the DObject to add to the group
activate - if true the DObject is activated immediately, if false, it is left in the inactive list until explicitly activated

requestDObjectCapability

protected void requestDObjectCapability(DObject requestor,
                                        DObjectID target,
                                        java.lang.String requestName,
                                        java.lang.Object data) throws java.lang.Exception
Interface for DObject <-> DObject capability requests. This is the interface for DObjects to make requests for capabilities of other DObjects securely, within the context provided by this view. This method is only called via the ViewDObjectFacet, and is protected so no untrusted code can call it.

If the recipient of this request wishes to respond, it will do so by calling giveCapability on its ViewDObject facet, which will try to give back the capability provided to the requestor via a CapabilityReceipt object.

Parameters:
requestor - the DObject doing the requesting
target - the DObjectID of the target of the request
requestName - a String identifying the request name
data - any data that the requestor wishes to send along (some targets may require that some data is sent along
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown under different failure conditions
See Also:
CapabilityReceipt, requestCapability, giveDObjectCapability, requestCapability

addReceiptToPending

private void addReceiptToPending(CapabilityReceipt aReceipt)
Add a given CapbilityReceipt to the pending receipts list. This is done from within the View.requestDObjectCapability call to keep track of receipts issued, but not redeemed by the capability grantor.
Parameters:
aReceipt - the CapabilityReceipt object to add to the list. Assumed not to be null

giveDObjectCapability

protected void giveDObjectCapability(CapabilityReceipt receipt) throws java.lang.Exception
Give a DObject that requested a certain capability a response. This is called from the ViewDObjectFacet (only), when a capability grantor decides to respond to a capability request made by View.requestDObjectCapability. Receipt ignored if it is not on the pending list...which could happen if original requestor gets removed (is destroyed) before a response happens.
Parameters:
receipt - the CapabilityReceipt that is the response
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if (e.g.) the DObjectViewFacet for the original requestor has been nulled out

addDObjectFacet

protected void addDObjectFacet(DObjectFacet aFacet)
Add given DObjectFacet to the Vector of facets maintained by the View. Reference to these facets are maintained by this View so that they can be revoked and removed forcibly by this view in the event of partition. This guarantees that all DObjectFacets are automatically cleaned up in the event of a partition (trusted or untrusted alike).
Parameters:
aFacet - the DObjectFacet to add
See Also:
revokeAndRemoveDObjectFacet

revokeAndRemoveDObjectFacet

protected void revokeAndRemoveDObjectFacet(DObjectFacet aFacet) throws NullFacetException
Call DObjectFacet.revoke(View) and then remove the given facet from our list of facets. This cleans up the given facet.
Parameters:
aFacet - the DObjectFacet to remove
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if dobject facet has already been revoked

removeFacetsForID

protected void removeFacetsForID(DObjectID id)
Revoke and then remove all DObjectFacets for given ID.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID for which all DObjectFacets will be revoked

removeReceiptFromPending

private CapabilityReceipt removeReceiptFromPending(CapabilityReceipt aReceipt)
Method to remove a CapabilityReceipt from the pending receipts list. Called from giveDObjectCapability (if grantor responds, one way or the other), and from removeReceiptsForID, which removes the receipts that are pending if one or both of the parties disappear without completing the protocol (on partition, etc.).
Parameters:
aReceipt - the CapabilityReceipt to remove
Returns:
the CapabilityReceipt removed (if removed successfully), or null if not present in the list of pending receipts (already removed)

removeReceiptsForID

protected final void removeReceiptsForID(DObjectID id)
Remove all pending receipts from/to given DObjectID from the pending capability receipts list. This is called by the list manager to remove any pending receipts (clean up) when a DObject has left prematurely (i.e. via partition, leaving, etc.). Removes the receipt if either the sender or the receiver has left.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the object (sender or receiver of capability request) to be removed
See Also:
destroyDObject

Method to add the given DObject as a listener for the arrival/departure of other DObjects. This will be called by DObject.addDObjectListener
Parameters:
object - the DObject that wishes to be notified when another DObject arrives/departs
See Also:
addDObjectListener

removeDObjectListener

protected void removeDObjectListener(DObject object)
Method to remove the given DObject as a listener for the arrival/departure of other DObjects. This will be called by DObject.removeDObjectListener.
See Also:
addDObjectListener

getDObjectForID

protected DObject getDObjectForID(DObjectID id)
Get a handle on actual DObject, given it's DObjectID. Returns null if not found. Declared protected so that no untrusted code can get at this method. Mostly used for testing.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID that we're looking for
Returns:
DObject that we're looking for. If not found, returns null.

                         java.lang.String message)

e - the Exception
message - the String message to print
